abstract: An economic downturn in Russia could swell the ranks of protesters who have opposed the re-election of Vladimir V. Putin as president, the former minister Aleksei L. Kudrin said.
snippet: An economic downturn in Russia could swell the ranks of protesters who have opposed the re-election of Vladimir V. Putin as president, the former minister Aleksei L. Kudrin said.
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — The economy in Russia is now as likely to sink into recession as it is to continue to grow, a prominent former finance minister said on Thursday.

headline.main: Putin Ally Warns of Political Fallout if Economy Falters
headline.print_headline: Russian Recession Could Prompt Political Woes, Report Says
